fields.description:
We've notice a couple of API changes in 4.1.1 which can break plugins compiled against earlier versions and which will prevent plugins compiled against 4.1.1 or greater to break in earlier versions.

So far I've found:

SpaceManager#removeSpace(Space) - now returns a 'Boolean', causing a 
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceManager.removeSpace(Lcom/atlassian/confluence/spaces/Space;)V

and:

ConfluenceIndexManager#flushQueue() - now returns 'boolean', causing a similar exception.

and I expect there may be more cases.
fields.summary: API changes in Confluence 4.1.1 breaking compatibility

fields.description:
This is raised on behalf of [CSP-73205|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-73205] (not publicly accessible). And cross-posted in [UPM-1619|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/UPM-1619].

For some reason, new UPM duplicates listener modules when you try to install existing plugin. Consequence is quite bad. You can reinstall plugin 5 times and listener will be executed 5 times.

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
Use the attached [^test-listeners.zip] which contains:
- test-listeners-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
- test-listeners-2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
- test-listeners-3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
- README.txt
And follow the quoated README.txt
{quote}
DESCRIPTION

Test listener plugin contains a listener, which is executed on template update event.
All in all, three versions of plugin are provided.
When listener method is executed, each of three versions displays version-specific message:
v. 1.0-SNAPSHOT: '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v1!'
v. 2.0-SNAPSHOT: '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v2!'
v. 3.0-SNAPSHOT: '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v3!'

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

- Run confluence 4.0.5.
- Install Test listeners plugin v. 1.0-SNAPSHOT by uploading test-listeners-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file.
- Go to Import Templates in Confluence admin and import any template to Global templates or some space.
- Check that log file contains WARN level message '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v1!'.
- Uninstall Test listeners plugin v. 1.0-SNAPSHOT.
- Install Test listeners plugin v. 2.0-SNAPSHOT by uploading test-listeners-2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file.
- One more time go to Import Templates and import any template to Global templates or some space.
- Check that log file contains 2 WARN level messages:
	1) '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v1!'
	2) '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v2!'
- Uninstall Test listeners plugin v. 2.0-SNAPSHOT.
- Install Test listeners plugin v. 3.0-SNAPSHOT by uploading test-listeners-3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file.
- Go to Import Templates and import any template to Global templates or some space.
- Check that log file contains 3 WARN level messages:
	1) '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v1!'
	2) '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v2!'
	3) '@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ Executed in TemplateImportedListener v3!'
{quote}

h5. Workaround
The current workaround is to shutdown Confluence, remove plugin caches and restart Confluence. Unfortunately, this is not practical users.
fields.summary: Listener modules are duplicated on plugin upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24322].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition 

Security of Confluence content is very important for many of our customers and securing the login action is the first step to ensure valid authentication to protect confidential information. Currently, Confluence offers only email/username password combination is available.

h3. Suggested Solution

Two factors authentication can be adopted to add more security to Confluence login action.
Many solutions are available, like *Gmail* approach for two factor:
* SMS based, no new hardware needed
* Can authorize a browser for up to 30 days from a single two factors auth (e.g. only pw is needed for 30 days, and on day 31 you have to do the whole two factors dance)
* Gmails approach is a nice combination of security and ease of use but others are available too.

h3. Plugins as workaround 
There is 2 plugin offering this features
# [2-Factor Auth Secure Login - Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.syracom.confluence.plugins.securelogin/server/overview]
# [Duo for Confluence|https://duo.com/docs/confluence].
fields.summary: Two Factor authorization, like Gmail has, to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24320].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

Any time a URL contains a character that is invalid as per the [URI RFC|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt], or one of a small set of *valid* characters ("*", "[", "]", "'", " ' "), the link will fail to save correctly. The link will appear on the page, but not clickable. The anchor tag is empty and the URL is not saved into the BODYCONTENT table.

Similar behavior occurs when inserting an image from the web with an URL containing an invalid character. While the image renders in edit mode, upon saving the page there will be a red "Broken Image" placeholder.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

* Click Link > Web Link tab
* Insert an URL with an invalid character. For example: http://www.google.com/* (this is a bogus URL)
* Click Insert
* Save page

h4. Workaround:

Use an encoded entity in the format "%<hexit><hexit>" ([reference|http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp]) in place of the invalid character when injecting the URL.

OR a simpler way would be:

# Go to Google Shortner at https://goo.gl/
# Paste the URL
# Google will generate a *short url* for your URL which you will be able to link.
# Google will also be change your *long URL* to alphanumeric characters, which can also be saved.
fields.summary: Links and web images with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24314].
  {panel}

Due to a combination of historical migration bugs, Atlassian support has (for a very long time) been recommending to upgrading customers that if they are running a version of Confluence prior to 2.7.4, they upgrade to that version first before attempting to upgrade to anything more recent.

The product did not prevent upgrading directly to higher versions, but the probability of at best failure, and at worse data corruption/data loss were reasonably high.

As of Confluence 4.2, this policy is now reflected in the product: attempts to upgrade from versions prior to 2.7.4 will fail (with a message pointing the customer to the Confluence Upgrade Guide), and attempts to import data from versions prior to 2.7.4 will also explicitly fail.

The upgrade guide and backup import documentation will need to be updated to reflect this.
fields.summary: Document dropping of support for upgrading/importing from versions prior to 2.7.4

fields.description:
Please support Opera 11, specifically:
* sometimes, when editing a long page, the input area extends beyond the bottom of the viewport
* the Insert and Table drop-down buttons don't work (Macro Browser won't display, can't create tables)
* the Editor won't allow you to type the period character (verified against Firefox on the same machine/keyboard)
* pasting Editor content into a macro like toc-zone doesn't work (e.g. cut from body and paste into new toc-zone macro)
* selecting text using shift+ctrl+home/end only selects text up to the start/end of the currently-visible content (it should go right to the top/bottom of the Editor)

The latest version of the 'Supported Platforms' wiki (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms) does not list Opera. And, sure enough, the new editor doesn't work - where the pre-4.0 rich-text editor did work in the latest versions of Opera.

Opera is barely behind Safari (which is supported) in terms of browser market share. I work for a technical organisation that has recently upgraded to Confluence 4.1, and use of Opera here is twice as high.

Bad enough that we've lost wiki markup editor. At least support all the major browsers in the new version.
fields.summary: Support Opera for editing wiki pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
'Personal labels' usage Warnings are still implemented in Confluence  even though 'Personal Labels' has been deprecated in Confluence 4.1 

!YouAreOnlyPermittedToAddPersonalLabelsOnThisPage.png!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Confluence and create a space
# Make sure that the "Add" Pages permission (From Space Tools > Permission) is only given to your account
# Have other user to access a page from this space
# Try to add a label to one of the pages

h3. Expected Results
User will not be able to add labels to this page. This is an expected behavior as they do not have the correct permission. The warning dialog pop up should be something such as:

"You do not have the permission to add labels in this page"

h3. Actual Results
Users will get a misleading warning as follows:

"You are only permitted to add personal labels on this page"

h3. Notes

fields.description:
To reproduce on Firefox 9:
1. Create table with two columns.
2. Enter a text with line breaks (not paragraph breaks)
3. Mark the whole text (the text only, not the cell)
4. Press Ctrl+C for copying
5. In right cell press Ctrl+V for inserting
Result:
Line breaks have been converted to paragraph breaks, as you can see on the right side of the screenshot.

Note 1: When doing the same in IE8, only an additional space character is inserted at the beginning, the line breaks are correct.

Note 2: Firefox 9 (in contrast to IE8) has quite some problems with pasting and tables, so possibly this and other bug reports of mine have the same deeper cause.
fields.summary: Copying/pasting cell content with line breaks converts them to paragraph breaks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24296].
  {panel}

Currently what happens if you copy&paste some cells from a table (either from within another confluence table or from external sources like Excel) is often unpredictable and seems to be dependent on the browser used (Firefox 9 vs. IE ), the source and some other conditions unknown to me, because it varies from time to time and PC to PC.
This is clearly not acceptable. Tabular data from any internal and external source must be treated equally and in a way the user can influence.

I every office suite I know there is this "Paste as ..." action where the user can choose how to cope with the content in the clipboard. I believe it is time that Confluence also explicitly asks the user how he wants to to insert tabular data from the clipboard

  * either "overwrite existing table data"
(possibly asking the user if the existing table is to be extended if it is too small for the content to fit in, otherwise truncating the content in a sensible way retaining the correct columns below each other)
  * or "insert into a table" that is, inserting as new rows into the existing table, possibly with some empty columns
  * or "insert as table", that is, add it as a separate table within one table cell if applies

IMHO "overwriting existing table data" should be the default behaviour.
fields.summary: Make it explicit how tablular content is pasted into/as a table
make "summary" field bigger on People calendars

fields.description:
Using a {tip} inside a {section} macro, the footer appears in the middle of page. 

!footer_35.jpg!

In confluence 4.1, the footer disappears.
fields.summary: footer appearing on middle of page using a tip inside a macro section
Editor eats empty bullets on save

fields.description:
To reproduce

- Insert the following text as a wiki markup block:

{code}
* foo
** bar
** boz
** aaa
* frob
{code}

- Use the mouse to select "aaa" and then press the delete key to remove it. The results should be as shown in "bullet1.png".
- Click the pointer in front of the word "bar".
- Press <Shift-Down>
- Press <Shift-Down>
- Press <Shift-Right>. The results should now be as shown in "bullet2.png".
- Click the "left indent" button.

The rather confused results are shown in bullet3.png. Bar and boz have been correctly unindented, but the empty bullet remains with its original indentation. Additionally, the "frob" has had its bullet removed and been pushed to a new line.

(The expected results were to simply unindent the three lines that were highlighted in bullet2.png.)
fields.summary: Unindentation of bullets incorrectly indents lines not included in selection & removes bullets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24291].
  {panel}

With the new WYSIWYG editor tables look like they do in a usual office suite, so people of course expect they behave pretty much the same. However this is not the case with applied formattings in Confluence.

Specifically, when inserting a new line (row) into a table whose columns have certain alignment and format, the new line will always have the default formatting and alignment, which means that every time a new line is inserted alignment and formatting have to be manually restored.
See screenshot of a typical result.

I am aware that in a wiki having formatting without content might be somewhat problematic (in contrast to an office suite).

Still I feel that at least the alignment should be inherited from the line where the cursor previously was. This is simply what users expect and what reduces unnecessary formatting work.

This behaviour might be configurable in case some users prefer it the current way.
fields.summary: Allow alignment to be inherited from existing table line when inserting new line

fields.description:
I have a page containing two tables with 6 columns and about 150 lines each ... which in a production environment and our field of work is not even "really large". One of the columns holds the status macro (green,yellow, red) for every line within these tables.

It takes 9 seconds for Confluence to insert one new table line using either the toolbar or the shortcut. 
Deleting the very same lines only takes the fraction of a second, though. Also, on small tables inserting a new record is quick as well. So it's seemingly the table length and number of tables on the page that slows it down.

Joe Wai Tye [Atlassian] tested this and found that it took him 2s on a page with one 150 row almost empty table, so with two tables we would be talking about the same order of mangnitude.

He also tested on Chrome and found it to be significantly faster in this respect.

So this looks like a browser specific performance issue.
fields.summary: Inserting new lines in tables is slow on large tables (>100 rows)

Here is the reproduction procedure:

fields.description:
h3.Description
Headings that contain en dashes, "--", seem to break anchor links. Example would be headings like *hi -- lo* (with {{\-\-}} between *hi* and *lo*), and anchor links of #hi-lo

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence 4
# Insert lots of content (to generate a vertical scroll bar on the browser during page view) to the page
# Insert *hi -- lo* (with Heading 1 formatting, and with en dash {{\-\-}} in between *hi* and *lo*) at the end of the page content
# Insert a link with anchor link to {{#hi-lo}}
# Notice that when you click on the anchor link, the page does not scroll to the header. It just stays put. Removing the en dash from the heading though, eradicates the problem

Note that this is only reproducible on Confluence 4.0. Confluence 3.5 produces desired effect even with en dash.
fields.summary: En dash in heading title breaks anchor links

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# Type one line of text
# Attempt to highlight the text by dragging (or Shift + Home)

Most of the time, the invisible line above the line of text will be selected. Sometimes the line below it will get selected as well.

This becomes problematic when applying list styles as can be seen in this [video|http://screencast.com/t/EJHFBfqg0DF]

h6. Reproduced on
CAC
EAC

h6. Using
Chrome
Safari

Not reproduced using
Firefox 8
IE8
fields.summary: Attempting to highlight first line of text in a body macro causes over selection in Webkit

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: # Create a new page # Type {{[}} to start autocompleting a link. # Type "Foo". # Using the mouse, click "Insert Link to Create New Page" # Press Enter twice. # Type {{[}} to start autocompleting a link. # Type "Bar". # Using the mouse, click "Insert Web Link".\\ _NOTE: In javascript-land, this is where the problem starts._ # Click the "Advanced" tab. # Type "Some Text". # Click out of the text field. The "Insert" button will become enabled. \\ _Is this another bug? I don't know._ # Click "Insert". You will notice some strangeness here: The newly inserted "Link" appears to be linked, but it is in fact not linked at all. Upon inspecting the source, you will likely have the following: {code:html}

Foo

 

Bar

" {code} What appears to be happening is that, upon auto-completing the second link (tinyMce-autocomplete-settings-links.js, line 70), the link browser is being passed some HTML for the text of the link: {{

Michael

}}. When the link is created with the "Advanced" tab, by all accounts the link-browser does the "right thing" – it creates a new link and inserts the aforementioned "text" of the link in the middle. It all goes horribly wrong when it attempts to insert it in to the browser, though. Because the link browser has created some code to the tune of {{

Michael

}}, and we are inserting the link inside another paragraph (via the {{NodeUtils.replaceNode()}} javascript function, *something* – possibly TinyMCE, possibly Confluence's code, but likely IE8 – is converting that in to {{

Michael

}}.
fields.summary: Editor adding invalid markup when inserting web link in IE8

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
This error occurs for new installations of 4.0.3 where, in the setup wizard, the user has opted to install the demo space. And under certain circumstances which the error is caused by a malformed row in the table *bodycontent*.

*However it is not fixed on upgrade, the error remains.*

Here are the steps that you can take to reproduce this bug :

# Install a clean instance of Confluence 4.0.3. (Installed by following the setup wizard, and set user management to 'Manage Users and Groups within Confluence')
# Access {{Browse>Space Directory}} and there will be an error. The stack trace is as follows :

{code}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getBodyAsString' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$f653be5e threw exception java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: The body of this ContentEntityObject ('') was 'BodyType:XHTML' but was expected to be 'BodyType:WIKI' at /templates/spacedirectory.vm[line 62, column 71]
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
...	
Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: The body of this ContentEntityObject ('') was 'BodyType:XHTML' but was expected to be 'BodyType:WIKI'
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.getBodyContent(ContentEntityObject.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.getBodyAsString(ContentEntityObject.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject$$FastClassByCGLIB$$96df24d5.invoke(<generated>)
	at net.sf.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:149)
	at net.sf.hibernate.proxy.CGLIBLazyInitializer.intercept(CGLIBLazyInitializer.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.SpaceDescription$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$f653be5e.getBodyAsString(<generated>)
	... 197 more
{code}

h2.Workaround
# Open this URL in your browser: <Confluence-URL>/admin/force-upgrade.action
# Select *changeSpaceDescriptionsBodyTypeUpgradeTask* in the Upgrade task to run dropdown list.
# Choose Force Upgrade.

Hope This helps!
fields.summary: Exception upon opening "Browse -> Spacedirectory" in Browse is not fixed by the upgrade.

fields.description:
There is a different behavior when making the following step on Firefox and Chrome:
# On a page, add the text: 
"line 1" >>  change line >> "line 2"
# Add the Numbered list for the string "line 1", then press "Enter" to create an empty line with numbered.
# Then press the "Del" key to truncate the string "line 2" to the empty numbered line created in the previous step. 

Here we have a different behavior that:
* on Firefox, the "Numbered list" format was removed, see the video firefox_test.swf.
* on Chrome, the "Numbered list" format was reproduced on the truncated string, see the video chrom_test.swf. We've the same behavior with the Internet Explorer. 

Thanks in advance for your help.

Affects versions at least 3.5x or greater. We are using 3.5.13.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24227/invoke-embedded-crowd-login for many details.

Working with Joseph Clark.

Thanks,
Craig
Atlassian Admin at Indiana University

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
# Add a section to a page
# create a table in section (2x4 size is arbitrary) - add some text to cells 
# create a second table in section (2x4 size is arbitrary) - add some text to cells
# Preview page - notice cell spacing between table cells in table 2. Same behavior repeats for subsequent tables on page with Section included on it.
** Note that tables do not need to be inside the section.
** Viewed source from FF and Chrome and source is identical for each table. Same behavior in FF and Chrome. Same behavior if table has header or no header.

Screenshots attached displaying behavior. Also selected border=true for section and no border is being displayed. Not sure if that is related issue or something separate.

Issue related to support ticket: [CSP-73986|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-73986]
fields.summary: Multiple Tables within a Section renders second table with cell spacing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24274].
  {panel}

Via the tickets I can see Atlissian does not want customers using one instance of Confluence for multiple domains.

Please consider the scenario where Enterprise customers would be willing to pay for this feature via some kind of licensing model.

I am in talks with a large Bank on CMS/Wiki solutions beyond SharePoint. I brought Confluence up but the big concern is not being able to use multiple domains. The second is no support for virtualized cluster, but I can deal with that creatively.

Hosted solutions are not options due to the sensitivity of the data. Starting on the IT side,

https://webcash.bank.com
https://trade.bank.com

Would point load different spaces based on the domain name. Each space should not have awareness of the other. I know I can simulate this via Apache redirects, Virtual Hosting and removing the Dashboard link... but they want simplicity and some divisions are very territorial.

Infrastructure costs are very very high (requirements for redundancy, DR, networking, staff to monitor the systems, ect.. ect..) so they would have no issue paying for additional licensing for this feature.

I can see that to support this feature, Confluence simply needs to stop hard coding the base url. Instead, allow us to unlock more base urls if we purchases some kind of domain license and set corresponding "Site Homepage" urls with an option to remove the Dashboard link.

Please consider this as an option for all your products provided Atlissian is targetting the Enterprise market.
fields.summary: Allow Support for Multiple Domains through Purchasing of Multiple Licenses
